jparsec.observer

Class City

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.observer.City

  • public final class City
extends java.lang.Object
    A convenient class for city data management.

    Description

    This class contains full data of about 4200 cities/places around the world, providing a suitable way of getting coordinates of certain location to calculate ephemeris. Methods starting with 'get' perform the search for the main database of cities around the world, methods starting with 'find' extend the search for 8000 additional locations in Spain.

    Format

    Data is organized in arrays of type CityElement for each country, containing data objets with the convenient fields.

    Reference

    Data has been compiled using different sources and medias. Different catalogs have been used, and a lot of changes and updates were made manually. The height above see level was computed using the 4k elevation image at space-graphics.com. See it for details. The calculation made is an averaged measure of the altitude in a circle of radius r <= 5 km (5 km for the equator). In plane terrains maximum theoretical error is 15m. Typical errors will be about 50m.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)
    See Also:
    CityElement, Country

      • getCities

        public static CityElement[] getCities(Country.COUNTRY country_ID,
                      boolean SpainInDetail)
                               throws JPARSECException
        Get the cities for certain country.
        Parameters:
        country_ID - The ID constant of the country whose cities are required.
        SpainInDetail - True to return a detailed list of Spanish locations, instead of the main ones, in case the input country is Spain.
        Returns:
        The array CityElement[] containing cities for the selected country, or null if the database has no cities for a given country.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs reading the cities file.

      • findAllCities

        public static CityElement[] findAllCities(java.lang.String city_location)
                                   throws JPARSECException
        Find all cities given it's name or part of it. Returned array is ordered in descent order respect the relevance of the city found.
        Parameters:
        city_location - The name of the city or representative part of it's name.
        Returns:
        The list of cities, or null if none is found.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • findAllCities

        public static CityElement[] findAllCities(java.lang.String city_location,
                          int max)
                                   throws JPARSECException
        Find all cities given it's name or part of it. Returned array is ordered in descent order respect the relevance of the city found.
        Parameters:
        city_location - The name of the city or representative part of it's name.
        max - Maximum number of locations to return. 0 or negative will return all found.
        Returns:
        The list of cities, or null if none is found.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • findAllCitiesssss

        public static CityElement[] findAllCitiesssss(java.lang.String city_location,
                              boolean SpainInDetail)
                                       throws JPARSECException
        Find all cities given it's name or part of it. Returned array is ordered in descent order respect the relevance of the city found.
        Parameters:
        city_location - The name of the city or representative part of it's name.
        SpainInDetail - True to use the detailed file for Spanish cities. False recommended for Android systems.
        Returns:
        The list of cities, or null if none is found.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • findCity

        public static CityElement findCity(java.lang.String city_location)
                            throws JPARSECException
        Find one city given it's name or part of it.
        Parameters:
        city_location - The name of the city or representative part of it's name. In case several locations could exists with the same name, you can use the suffix [0] to get the first, [1] for the second, and so on. The complete list of locations with a given name is provided by findAllCities(String).
        Returns:
        The object CityElement containing the first city that matches the search, or the best match. Null if none is found. In case several are found with the provided name the most relevant one is returned (for Spanish cities the one using the detailed file), equivalent to adding the suffix [0] to the name (first result).
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • findNearestCity

        public static CityElement findNearestCity(LocationElement loc)
                                   throws JPARSECException
        Find the nearest city to certain coordinates.
        Parameters:
        loc - The approximate coordinates of the city.
        Returns:
        The object CityElement containing the city that best matches the search.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - Thrown if the city is not found.

      • findNearestCity

        public static CityElement findNearestCity(LocationElement loc,
                          Country.COUNTRY country,
                          double radius)
                                   throws JPARSECException
        Find the nearest city to certain coordinates.
        Parameters:
        loc - The approximate coordinates of the city.
        country - The country where this position is located. Maybe null to search in all countries, but in this case the special file with the detailed locations in Spain will not be read.
        radius - The radius of the search in radians, for instance 10 degrees (in radians).
        Returns:
        The object CityElement containing the city that best matches the search, or null if no one can be found within the radius.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - Thrown if an error occurs.
